canonical_explanation.text: Data means information we collect by counting or recording. We can count things and put them in groups. A pictograph uses pictures to show how many of each thing there are. Each picture stands for one object. We can look at a pictograph to find out which group has the most, which has the least, and how many are in each group.
rules: Data is information collected by counting.
We can group objects and count how many are in each group.
A pictograph uses pictures to show numbers.
Each picture in a simple pictograph stands for 1 object.
We can compare groups to find the most and the least.

questions.question_text: In a class, there are 5 boys and 3 girls. How many boys are there?
questions.explanation_correct: There are 5 boys. The question directly tells us this.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The data says 5 boys and 3 girls. The number of boys is 5.

questions.question_text: Aarav counted the fruits in a basket: 4 apples, 6 bananas, 2 oranges. How many bananas are there?
questions.explanation_correct: There are 6 bananas in the basket.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Aarav counted 4 apples, 6 bananas, 2 oranges. Bananas = 6.

questions.question_text: Priya counted the animals on a farm: 3 cows, 5 hens, 2 goats. How many animals are there in total?
questions.explanation_correct: 3 + 5 + 2 = 10 animals in total.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Add all: 3 cows + 5 hens + 2 goats = 10 animals.

questions.question_text: A pictograph shows: ðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽ = apples, ðŸŒðŸŒðŸŒ = bananas. How many apples are there?
questions.explanation_correct: Count the apple pictures: 4 apples.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Each picture = 1 fruit. There are 4 apple pictures, so 4 apples.

questions.question_text: A pictograph shows: ðŸ¶ðŸ¶ðŸ¶ðŸ¶ðŸ¶ = dogs, ðŸ±ðŸ±ðŸ± = cats. How many cats are there?
questions.explanation_correct: Count the cat pictures: 3 cats.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Each picture = 1 animal. There are 3 cat pictures, so 3 cats.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: ðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽ = apples, ðŸŒðŸŒðŸŒðŸŒðŸŒðŸŒ = bananas, ðŸŠðŸŠ = oranges. Which fruit has the most?
questions.explanation_correct: Bananas have 6, apples have 4, oranges have 2. Bananas have the most.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Count each: apples = 4, bananas = 6, oranges = 2. 6 is the most.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: â­â­â­â­â­ = red, â­â­â­ = blue, â­â­â­â­â­â­â­ = green. Which colour has the least stars?
questions.explanation_correct: Blue has 3 stars, which is the least. Red has 5, green has 7.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Red = 5, blue = 3, green = 7. The least is 3 (blue).

questions.question_text: In a garden: 3 roses, 3 sunflowers, 5 marigolds. Which flower has the most?
questions.explanation_correct: Marigolds have 5, which is more than 3. Marigolds have the most.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 3 roses, 3 sunflowers, 5 marigolds. 5 > 3, so marigolds are the most.

questions.question_text: Favourite ice cream flavours: Chocolate - 7 children, Vanilla - 4 children, Strawberry - 7 children. Which flavours are liked by the same number?
questions.explanation_correct: Chocolate has 7 and strawberry has 7. They have the same number.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Chocolate = 7, vanilla = 4, strawberry = 7. Chocolate and strawberry are both 7.

questions.question_text: Diya counted the shapes in her box: 6 circles, 4 squares, 3 triangles. How many shapes in all?
questions.explanation_correct: 6 + 4 + 3 = 13 shapes in all.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Add: 6 circles + 4 squares + 3 triangles = 13 shapes.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: ðŸš—ðŸš—ðŸš— = red cars, ðŸš—ðŸš—ðŸš—ðŸš—ðŸš— = blue cars, ðŸš—ðŸš— = white cars. How many more blue cars than red cars?
questions.explanation_correct: Blue = 5, red = 3. 5 - 3 = 2 more blue cars.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Blue cars (5) minus red cars (3) = 2 more blue cars.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: ðŸŒ¸ðŸŒ¸ðŸŒ¸ðŸŒ¸ = roses, ðŸŒ¸ðŸŒ¸ðŸŒ¸ðŸŒ¸ðŸŒ¸ðŸŒ¸ = jasmine, ðŸŒ¸ðŸŒ¸ðŸŒ¸ = marigold. How many fewer marigolds than jasmine?
questions.explanation_correct: Jasmine = 6, marigold = 3. 6 - 3 = 3 fewer marigolds.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Jasmine (6) minus marigold (3) = 3 fewer marigolds.

questions.question_text: Data means information we collect by counting.
questions.explanation_correct: True. Data is information we gather, often by counting objects.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. When we count and record, we are collecting data.

questions.question_text: In a pictograph, each picture stands for 1 object.
questions.explanation_correct: True. In a simple pictograph for Class 1, each picture represents 1 object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. In basic pictographs, 1 picture = 1 object.

questions.question_text: Favourite sports: Cricket - 8, Football - 5, Kho-Kho - 3. Which sport is liked the least?
questions.explanation_correct: Kho-Kho has 3, which is the least among 8, 5, and 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cricket = 8, football = 5, kho-kho = 3. The smallest number is 3.

questions.question_text: Neha counted birds: 4 parrots, 2 crows, 3 sparrows. How many birds in total? ____
questions.explanation_correct: 4 + 2 + 3 = 9 birds in total.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Add: 4 parrots + 2 crows + 3 sparrows = 9 birds.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: ðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆ = Ravi, ðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆ = Meera, ðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆ = Kabir. Who has the most balloons?
questions.explanation_correct: Kabir has 7 balloons, which is the most. Ravi has 5, Meera has 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ravi = 5, Meera = 3, Kabir = 7. Kabir has the most (7).

questions.question_text: A pictograph shows flowers: ðŸŒºðŸŒºðŸŒºðŸŒºðŸŒºðŸŒºðŸŒºðŸŒº. How many flowers are shown?
questions.explanation_correct: Count the flower pictures: 8 flowers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Count each picture: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8. There are 8 flowers.

questions.question_text: Toys in a shop: Dolls - 6, Cars - 6, Balls - 4. Which toys have the same count?
questions.explanation_correct: Dolls (6) and cars (6) have the same count.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dolls = 6, cars = 6, balls = 4. Dolls and cars are both 6.

questions.question_text: Aarav collected leaves: 5 neem leaves, 3 mango leaves, 7 banyan leaves. Which type did he collect the most?
questions.explanation_correct: Banyan leaves = 7, which is the most among 5, 3, and 7.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Neem = 5, mango = 3, banyan = 7. The most is 7 (banyan).

questions.question_text: Pictograph: â­â­â­ = boys, â­â­â­â­â­ = girls. How many more girls than boys? ____
questions.explanation_correct: Girls = 5, boys = 3. 5 - 3 = 2 more girls.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Girls (5) minus boys (3) = 2 more girls.

questions.question_text: Pictograph of favourite fruits: ðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽ = mango, ðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽ = apple, ðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽ = banana. How many children chose banana?
questions.explanation_correct: Banana has 4 pictures, so 4 children chose banana.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Count banana pictures: 4. So 4 children chose banana.

questions.question_text: Vehicles on a road: 8 cars, 3 buses, 5 bikes. Which vehicle is seen the most?
questions.explanation_correct: Cars = 8, which is the most. Buses = 3, bikes = 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 8 > 5 > 3. Cars (8) are seen the most.

questions.question_text: What does a pictograph use to show data?
questions.explanation_correct: A pictograph uses pictures to show data.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pictographs use small pictures or symbols to represent objects.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: ðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µ = Class A, ðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µ = Class B, ðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µ = Class C. Which class has the most students?
questions.explanation_correct: Class C has 8, which is the most. A has 6, B has 4.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A = 6, B = 4, C = 8. Class C (8) has the most.

questions.question_text: Ravi has 3 red balls, 2 blue balls, and 4 green balls. He has ____ balls in total.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Add: 3 red + 2 blue + 4 green = 9 balls.

questions.question_text: Stickers collected: Priya - 9, Aarav - 6, Diya - 9, Kabir - 4. Who collected the fewest?
questions.explanation_correct: Kabir collected 4 stickers, the fewest among all.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Priya = 9, Aarav = 6, Diya = 9, Kabir = 4. The smallest is 4 (Kabir).

questions.question_text: In a pictograph, if there are 5 star pictures for Monday, it means 5 stars were seen on Monday.
questions.explanation_correct: True. Each picture = 1 star. 5 pictures = 5 stars.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. In a simple pictograph, 1 picture = 1 object.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: ðŸ¦ðŸ¦ðŸ¦ðŸ¦ = parrots, ðŸ¦ðŸ¦ðŸ¦ðŸ¦ðŸ¦ðŸ¦ = sparrows, ðŸ¦ðŸ¦ = crows. How many birds in total?
questions.explanation_correct: Parrots (4) + sparrows (6) + crows (2) = 12 birds.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 4 + 6 + 2 = 12 birds in total.

questions.question_text: Flowers in a garden: Roses - 5, Lilies - 5, Marigolds - 5. What can we say?
questions.explanation_correct: All three types have 5 flowers. They are the same.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 5 = 5 = 5. All three types have the same number.

questions.question_text: Tanvi counted the colours of her crayons: 3 red, 2 blue, 4 green, 1 yellow. How many crayons does she have?
questions.explanation_incorrect: Add: 3 + 2 + 4 + 1 = 10 crayons.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: ðŸªðŸªðŸª = Monday, ðŸªðŸªðŸªðŸªðŸª = Tuesday, ðŸªðŸª = Wednesday. On which day were the most cookies sold?
questions.explanation_correct: Tuesday has 5 cookies, which is the most.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Monday = 3, Tuesday = 5, Wednesday = 2. Tuesday (5) is the most.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: âš½âš½âš½âš½âš½âš½ = boys playing, âš½âš½âš½âš½ = girls playing. How many more boys than girls are playing?
questions.explanation_correct: Boys = 6, girls = 4. 6 - 4 = 2 more boys.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 6 boys minus 4 girls = 2 more boys.

questions.question_text: Children counted vehicles passing school: Auto - 4, Car - 7, Bus - 2, Bike - 6. Which vehicle passed the most?
questions.explanation_correct: Cars = 7, which is the most among 4, 7, 2, 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Auto = 4, car = 7, bus = 2, bike = 6. Car (7) is the most.

questions.question_text: Books read: Aarav - 3, Priya - 5, Kabir - 2. Who read the most books? ____
questions.explanation_correct: Priya read 5 books, which is the most.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Aarav = 3, Priya = 5, Kabir = 2. Priya (5) read the most.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ = Riya, ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ = Ankit, ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ = Meera. Who has fewer stars than Riya but more than Ankit?
questions.explanation_correct: Riya = 7, Meera = 5, Ankit = 4. Meera (5) is between Riya (7) and Ankit (4).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Meera has 5 stars: less than Riya's 7 but more than Ankit's 4.

questions.question_text: Counting objects and recording the numbers is called collecting data.
questions.explanation_correct: True. When we count and record, we are collecting data.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Data collection involves counting and recording.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: ðŸŸðŸŸðŸŸðŸŸðŸŸ = pond A, ðŸŸðŸŸðŸŸðŸŸðŸŸðŸŸðŸŸðŸŸ = pond B. How many more fish in pond B?
questions.explanation_correct: Pond B has 8 fish, pond A has 5. 8 - 5 = 3 more fish.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Pond B (8) minus pond A (5) = 3 more fish in pond B.

questions.question_text: Snacks brought to school: Sandwiches - 8, Parathas - 6, Idli - 4. Which snack was brought the least?
questions.explanation_correct: Idli was brought by 4 children, which is the least.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sandwiches = 8, parathas = 6, idli = 4. Idli (4) is the least.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: ðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽ = Priya, ðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽ = Aarav. How many gifts does Aarav have? ____
questions.explanation_correct: Count Aarav's gifts: 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Aarav has 6 gift pictures, so he has 6 gifts.

questions.question_text: Kavita surveyed her class about pets. Dogs - 9, Cats - 5, Fish - 3, Birds - 2. How many children have pets?
questions.explanation_correct: 9 + 5 + 3 + 2 = 19 children.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Add: 9 + 5 + 3 + 2 = 19 children have pets.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: ðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽ = Monday, ðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽ = Tuesday, ðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽðŸŽ = Wednesday. On which day were the fewest apples sold?
questions.explanation_correct: Tuesday has 3 apples, which is the fewest.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Monday = 5, Tuesday = 3, Wednesday = 6. Tuesday (3) has the fewest.

questions.question_text: Marbles: Red - 4, Blue - 4. What can we say?
questions.explanation_correct: Red = 4, blue = 4. They have the same number.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 4 = 4. Both groups are the same.

questions.question_text: Rohan counted insects: 6 butterflies, 8 ants, 1 ladybird. Which insect did he see the most?
questions.explanation_correct: Ants = 8, which is the most among 6, 8, and 1.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Butterflies = 6, ants = 8, ladybird = 1. Ants (8) are the most.

questions.question_text: A pictograph of favourite colours shows ðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µ for blue and ðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µðŸ”µ for red. Red is liked by more children.
questions.explanation_correct: True. Red has 7 pictures, blue has 3. 7 > 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Red = 7, blue = 3. More children like red.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: ðŸŒ»ðŸŒ»ðŸŒ»ðŸŒ»ðŸŒ»ðŸŒ» = sunflowers, ðŸŒ»ðŸŒ»ðŸŒ»ðŸŒ»ðŸŒ»ðŸŒ»ðŸŒ»ðŸŒ»ðŸŒ» = roses. How many more roses than sunflowers? ____
questions.explanation_correct: Roses = 9, sunflowers = 6. 9 - 6 = 3 more roses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 9 roses minus 6 sunflowers = 3 more roses.

questions.question_text: In Arjun's class: 6 children walk to school, 8 come by bus, 4 come by car. How many come by bus or car?
questions.explanation_correct: Bus (8) + car (4) = 12 children come by bus or car.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 8 + 4 = 12 children come by bus or car.

questions.question_text: Ananya counted fruits: 5 mangoes, 3 apples. How many more mangoes than apples? ____
questions.explanation_correct: 5 - 3 = 2. There are 2 more mangoes than apples.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 5 mangoes minus 3 apples = 2 more mangoes.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ = Monday, ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ = Tuesday. What can we say?
questions.explanation_correct: Both Monday and Tuesday have 6 stars. They are the same.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Monday = 6 stars, Tuesday = 6 stars. They are equal.

questions.question_text: Pictograph: ðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆ = red, ðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆ = blue, ðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆðŸŽˆ = green. Which colour has 2 more than blue?
questions.explanation_correct: Blue = 5. Green = 7. 7 - 5 = 2 more. Green has 2 more than blue.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Blue = 5. Red = 9 (4 more), green = 7 (2 more). Green has exactly 2 more than blue.
